column4: Hey everyone, I was on here last night trying to get help with my home server issues, but it was late and I had to run, so I'll ask here again. The issue that I am having is that my server can no longer get an IP address from my Linksys router (which is loaded with the dd-wrt firmware). The router used to give out, and still should, a static IP address based on the MAC address of the network device asking for one. The other 4 compu

ters in the house, can all get an IP address just fine wirelessly, and the one other computer and VOIP device hooked up using ethernet (like the server box is) can also get their IP addresses just fine. No other system is having an issue other than this server box. I have tried the following things 1) Tried 3 different cables (that all work with my other machine) 2) Two separate Ethernet NICs (I have tested them both in another mac

hine, and they work). 3) I have formatted and reinstalled Ubuntu 8.04.1 Server addition again. Doing these things has not helped fix my issue. I was hoping if someone could help me troubleshoot this. It was all working fine untill last night when I physically moved the server about 10 feet into a new spot in the same room. I really don't know what to do anymore so any help would be greatly appreciated!
Please don't flood, use http://paste.ubuntu.com to paste, don't use Enter as punctuation.
